Definition: Idiopathic intracranial hypertension is a condition characterized by increased pressure in the skull without a clear cause.
Causes: Obesity, certain medications, and hormonal changes.
Symptoms: Headaches, vision changes, and ringing in the ears.
Diagnosis: Lumbar puncture, imaging studies, and clinical evaluation.
Treatment: Weight loss, medications, and in some cases, surgery.

Definition: Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis is a chronic lung disease that causes scarring of the lungs.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve genetic and environmental factors.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, dry cough, and fatigue.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies, lung function tests, and biopsy.
Treatment: Medications, oxygen therapy, and lung transplantation in severe cases.

Definition: IgA nephropathy is a kidney disorder characterized by the deposition of IgA antibodies in the kidney.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve genetic and environmental factors.
Symptoms: Blood in urine, protein in urine, and swelling.
Diagnosis: Urine tests, blood tests, and kidney biopsy.
Treatment: Blood pressure control, medications, and dietary changes.

Definition: Inflammatory breast cancer is a rare and aggressive form of breast cancer that blocks lymph vessels in the skin.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but risk factors include genetics and family history.
Symptoms: Swelling, redness, and warmth in the breast.
Diagnosis: Physical examination, imaging studies, and biopsy.

Definition: Insect bites and stings are injuries caused by the bite or sting of insects.
Causes: Bites from mosquitoes, bees, wasps, and other insects.
Treatment: Cold compresses, antihistamines, and pain relievers.

Definition: Insomnia is a sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep.
Causes: Stress, anxiety, medical conditions, and certain medications.
Symptoms: Difficulty sleeping, daytime fatigue, and irritability.
Diagnosis: Sleep history and sometimes sleep studies.
Treatment: Cognitive behavioral therapy, medications, and lifestyle changes.

Definition: Interstitial cystitis is a chronic condition causing bladder pressure, bladder pain, and sometimes pelvic pain.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve bladder lining damage.
Symptoms: Frequent urination, urgency, and pelvic pain.
Treatment: Medications, bladder instillations, and lifestyle changes.

Definition: Interstitial lung disease refers to a group of disorders that cause scarring of lung tissue.
Causes: Autoimmune diseases, environmental exposures, and certain medications.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, dry cough, and fatigue.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies, lung function tests, and biopsy.
Treatment: Medications, oxygen therapy, and pulmonary rehabilitation.

Definition: Intestinal pseudo-obstruction is a condition that mimics a bowel obstruction without a physical blockage.
Treatment: Medications, dietary changes, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Invasive ductal carcinoma is the most common type of breast cancer that begins in the milk ducts.
Causes: Genetic factors, hormonal influences, and lifestyle factors.
Symptoms: Lump in the breast, changes in breast shape, and discharge.
Treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and hormone therapy.

Definition: Invasive lobular carcinoma is a type of breast cancer that begins in the lobules of the breast.
Symptoms: Thickening of breast tissue, changes in breast shape, and sometimes a lump.
Treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and hormone therapy.

Definition: Inverted papilloma is a benign tumor that occurs in the nasal cavity and paranasal sinuses.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may be associated with HPV.
Symptoms: Nasal obstruction, bleeding, and facial pain.

Definition: Irritable bowel syndrome is a common gastrointestinal disorder characterized by abdominal pain and changes in bowel habits.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve gut-brain interaction.
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, and constipation.
Diagnosis: Clinical evaluation and exclusion of other conditions.
Treatment: Dietary changes, medications, and stress management.
